alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Coleman; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 6:35AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CALLAHAN...NORTHERN COLEMAN... EASTERN SHACKELFORD...SOUTHEASTERN TAYLOR AND NORTHEASTERN RUNNELS COUNTIES THROUGH 715 AM CST... At 635 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Albany to 7 miles northwest of Rowden to near Hatchel. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Coleman, Ballinger, Clyde, Winters, Albany, Baird, Cross Plains, Moran, Novice, Putnam, Dudley, Glen Cove, Ibex, Hatchel, Rowden, Silver Valley, Fort Griffin, Atwell, Benoit, and Crews. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 300 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
